data.title: What Happened on April 27, 1947
data.meta_description: What happened on April 27, 1947. Browse historical events, famous birthdays and notable deaths from Apr 27, 1947 or search by date, day or keyword.
data.text:
Historical Events

Babe Ruth Day

Babe Ruth Day celebrated at Yankee Stadium and throughout the US

Famous Birthdays

Ann Peebles, American soul singer-songwriter ("I Can't Stand the Rain"), born in St. Louis, Missouri

George Kenneth Butterfield, American politician, U.S. House of Representatives from North Carolina, born in Wilson, North Carolina

Herbie Murrell, American soul singer (Stylistics - "You Are My Everything"), born in Lane, South Carolina

Keith Magnuson, Canadian ice hockey defenseman (NHL All Star 1971, 72; Chicago Black Hawks), born in Wadena, Saskatchewan (d. 2003)

Pete Ham, Welsh rock singer-songwriter, and guitarist (Badfinger - "Without You"; "No Matter What"; Day After Day"), born in Swansea, Wales (d. 1975)

About April 27, 1947

Day of the Week: Sunday

How Long Ago? 77 years, 3 months and 13 days

Leap Year: No

Generation: Baby Boomer

Chinese Zodiac: Pig

Star Sign: Taurus
